It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its smooth, dark bark and dense, evergreen foliage. The plant exhibits a unique growth habit, often forming a rounded crown with thick, leathery leaves that remain throughout the year. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Gordonia vidalii is considered a conservation concern.
